results.body:
Cate Blanchett and Catherine Martin have collected Oscars and broken records at the Academy Awards.
 Cate Blanchett has won the best actress Oscar, putting an exclamation point on a golden and history-making night for Australia at the Academy Awards.
 Blanchett won for her performance in Woody Allen's drama, Blue Jasmine.
 It is the second Academy Award win of the Melbourne-born, Sydney-based Blanchett's career and followed fellow Aussie Catherine Martin's two Oscars on Sunday night for her work on The Great Gatsby.
 "There is so much talent in Australia," Blanchett said.
 "CM and I are just the tip of the iceberg." "
Blanchett was the white hot favourite for the actress Oscar, despite competing against high-calibre nominees Sandra Bullock (Gravity), Meryl Streep (August: Osage County), Judi Dench (Philomena) and Amy Adams (American Hustle).
 Blanchett becomes the first Australian actor to win more than one Oscar, setting herself apart from single winners Nicole Kidman, Geoffrey Rush, Russell Crowe, Peter Finch and Heath Ledger.
 She won a supporting actress trophy in 2005 for her portrayal of screen great Katharine Hepburn in the Howard Hughes biopic The Aviator.
 Martin won the costume design and production design Oscars, giving her four career Academy Awards, eclipsing another costume designer, Orry George Kelly, who was the Australian record-holder with three for An American in Paris, Cole Porter's Les Girls and the Marilyn Monroe, Tony Curtis and Jack Lemmon comedy Some Like it Hot in the 1950s and '60s.
 Martin shared her production design Oscar with The Great Gatsby set decorator Beverley Dunn.
 Earlier in the ceremony, Allen missed out on the original screenplay Oscar for Blue Jasmine, with Spike Jonze taking the honour for Her.
 Some commentators had suggested Blanchett should not mention Allen in her acceptance speech after he faced two decade old molestation accusations from his adopted daughter Dylan Farrow.
 Allen has not been charged for the alleged offences.
 Gravity has been the big winner at the awards, taking most of the technical categories and the director prize for Alfonso Cuaron while 12 Years A Slave won best picture.
 Dallas Buyers Club duo, Matthew McConaughey and Jared Leto, took the best actor and supporting actor awards while 12 Years A Slave's Lupita Nyong'o won the supporting actress Oscar.
results.title: Blanchett wins Oscar for Blue Jasmine

results.body:
Cate Blanchett has won the Oscar for best actress for her role in Woody Allen's Blue Jasmine at the Academy Awards in Los Angeles.
 Cate Blanchett has won the best actress Oscar, putting an exclamation point on a golden and history-making night for Australia at the Academy Awards.
 Blanchett won for her performance in Woody Allen's drama, Blue Jasmine.
 It is the second Academy Award win of the Melbourne-born, Sydney-based Blanchett's career and followed fellow Aussie Catherine Martin's two Oscars on Sunday night for her work on The Great Gatsby.
 ''There is so much talent in Australia,'' Blanchett said.
 ''CM and I are just the tip of the iceberg.' ''
Blanchett was the white hot favourite for the actress Oscar, despite competing against high-calibre nominees Sandra Bullock (Gravity), Meryl Streep (August: Osage County), Judi Dench (Philomena) and Amy Adams (American Hustle).
 Blanchett becomes the first Australian actor to win more than one Oscar, setting herself apart from single winners Nicole Kidman, Geoffrey Rush, Russell Crowe, Peter Finch and Heath Ledger.
 She won a supporting actress trophy in 2005 for her portrayal of screen great Katharine Hepburn in the Howard Hughes biopic The Aviator.
 Martin won the costume design and production design Oscars, giving her four career Academy Awards, eclipsing another costume designer, Orry George Kelly, who was the Australian record-holder with three for An American in Paris, Cole Porter's Les Girls and the Marilyn Monroe, Tony Curtis and Jack Lemmon comedy Some Like it Hot in the 1950s and '60s.
 Martin shared her production design Oscar with The Great Gatsby set decorator Beverley Dunn.
 Allen missed out on the original screenplay Oscar for Blue Jasmine, with Spike Jonze taking the honour for Her.  Some commentators had suggested Blanchett should not mention Allen in her acceptance speech after he faced molestation accusations from his adopted daughter Dylan Farrow.  He has not been charged.
 Blanchett did praise the director.  ''Thank you so much Woody for casting me,'' she said.
 Pictures: GETTY IMAGES
AAP
AAP

results.title: Blanchett wins Best Actress Oscar

results.body:
Cate Blanchett has won the best actress Oscar, putting an exclamation point on a golden and history-making night for Australia at the Academy Awards.
 Blanchett won for her performance in Woody Allen's comedy-drama, Blue Jasmine.
 It is the second Academy Award win of Blanchett's career and followed fellow Australian Catherine Martin's two Oscars on Sunday night for her work on The Great Gatsby.
 Blanchett was the white hot favourite for the actress Oscar, despite competing against high-calibre nominees Sandra Bullock (Gravity), Meryl Streep (August: Osage County), Judi Dench (Philomena) and Amy Adams (American Hustle).
 Blanchett becomes the first Australian actor to win more than one Oscar, setting herself apart from single winners Nicole Kidman, Geoffrey Rush, Russell Crowe, Peter Finch and Heath Ledger.
 She won a supporting actress trophy in 2005 for her portrayal of screen great Katharine Hepburn in the Howard Hughes biopic The Aviator.
 Martin won the costume design and production design Oscars, giving her four career Academy Awards, eclipsing another costume designer, Orry George Kelly, who was the Australian record-holder with three for An American in Paris, Cole Porter's Les Girls and the Marilyn Monroe, Tony Curtis and Jack Lemmon comedy Some Like it Hot in the 1950s and 60s.
 Martin shared her production design Oscar with The Great Gatsby set decorator Beverley Dunn.
 Earlier in the ceremony, Allen missed out on the original screenplay Oscar for Blue Jasmine, with Her's Spike Jonze taking the honour.
 Gravity has been the big winner at the awards, taking most of the technical categories and the director prize for Alfonso Cuaron.
 The big disappoint has been American Hustle, with 10 nominations but yet to win one.
 The 86th Academy Awards are being held at the Dolby Theatre in Hollywood.
results.title: Blanchett wins best actress Oscar

results.body:
Cate Blanchett has won the Academy Award for best actress for her bravura performance as a fragile socialite experiencing a meltdown in Woody Allen's "Blue Jasmine." "
Blanchett had been deemed the front-runner from the very beginning of the Oscar season.  It was the sixth Oscar nomination for the Australian actress and her second win, though her first in the leading actress category.  Previously she won the 2005 supporting actress trophy for "The Aviator." "
The other nominees Sunday night were: Amy Adams, "American Hustle"; Sandra Bullock, "Gravity"; Judi Dench, "Philomena"; and Meryl Streep, "August: Osage County".
results.title: Cate Blanchett wins Oscar for best actress | www.accessatlanta.com

results.body:
LOS ANGELES -- Cate Blanchett has won the Academy Award for best actress for her bravura performance as a fragile socialite experiencing a meltdown in Woody Allen's "Blue Jasmine." "
Blanchett had been deemed the front-runner from the very beginning of the Oscar season.  It was the sixth Oscar nomination for the Australian actress and her second win, though her first in the leading actress category.  Previously she won the 2005 supporting actress trophy for "The Aviator." "
The other nominees Sunday night were: Amy Adams, "American Hustle"; Sandra Bullock, "Gravity"; Judi Dench, "Philomena"; and Meryl Streep, "August: Osage County".
 The 86th Academy Awards are airing live on ABC from the Dolby Theatre in Los Angeles with host Ellen DeGeneres.

LOS ANGELES (AP) - Cate Blanchett has won the Academy Award for best actress for her bravura performance as a fragile socialite experiencing a meltdown in Woody Allen's "Blue Jasmine." "
Blanchett had been deemed the front-runner from the very beginning of the Oscar season.  It was the sixth Oscar nomination for the Australian actress and her second win, though her first in the leading actress category.  Previously she won the 2005 supporting actress trophy for "The Aviator." "
The other nominees Sunday night were: Amy Adams, "American Hustle"; Sandra Bullock, "Gravity"; Judi Dench, "Philomena"; and Meryl Streep, "August: Osage County".

results.title: Cate Blanchett wins Oscar for best actress

results.body:
Share
Cate Blanchett has won the best actress Oscar, putting an exclamation point on a golden and history-making night for Australia at the Academy Awards.
 Blanchett won for her performance in Woody Allen's drama, Blue Jasmine.
 It is the second Academy Award win of the Melbourne-born, Sydney-based Blanchett's career and followed fellow Aussie Catherine Martin's two Oscars on Sunday night for her work on The Great Gatsby.
 LIVE REPORT: OSCARS 2014 | PICTURE GALLERY: Red carpet glamour | BEST SELFIE EVER | MARTIN TOP OZ OSCAR WINNER
Blanchett was the white hot favourite for the actress Oscar, despite competing against high-calibre nominees Sandra Bullock (Gravity), Meryl Streep (August: Osage County), Judi Dench (Philomena) and Amy Adams (American Hustle).
 Blanchett becomes the first Australian actor to win more than one Oscar, setting herself apart from single winners Nicole Kidman, Geoffrey Rush, Russell Crowe, Peter Finch and Heath Ledger.
 She won a supporting actress trophy in 2005 for her portrayal of screen great Katharine Hepburn in the Howard Hughes biopic The Aviator.
 The 44-year-old had been the frontrunner for the gong after sweeping the awards season, picking up honours at the Golden Globes, the BAFTAs and the SAG awards.
 Blanchett's victory today comes despite recent controversy surrounding Blue Jasmine director Woody Allen, who has been accused of molesting his adopted daughter two decades ago.
 Dylan Farrow broke her silence on the claims earlier this year, writing an open letter accusing the famed director of abusing her as a seven-year-old.
 Allen strongly denies the claims and has accused his ex-partner Mia Farrow of fabricating the allegations.
 Martin, wife of director Baz Luhrmann, won the costume design and production design Oscars, giving her four career Academy Awards, eclipsing another costume designer, Orry George Kelly, who was the Australian record-holder with three for An American in Paris, Cole Porter's Les Girls and the Marilyn Monroe, Tony Curtis and Jack Lemmon comedy Some Like it Hot in the 1950s and 60s.
 Martin shared her production design Oscar with The Great Gatsby set decorator Beverley Dunn.
 Earlier in the ceremony, Allen missed out on the original screenplay Oscar for Blue Jasmine, with Spike Jonze taking the honour for Her.
 Gravity has been the big winner at the awards, taking most of the technical categories and the director prize for Alfonso Cuaron.
 The big disappointment has been American Hustle, with 10 nominations but failed to win one, with 12 Years a Slave the night's big winner, including Best Picture.
 The 86th Academy Awards were held at the Dolby Theatre in Hollywood.

The other nominees Sunday night were: Amy Adams, "American Hustle"; Sandra Bullock, "Gravity"; Judi Dench, "Philomena"; and Meryl Streep, "August: Osage County".

results.title: Cate Blanchett wins Oscar for best actress

results.body:
Cate Blanchett has won the 2014 Oscar for Best Actress in a Leading Role for her performance in Woody Allen's drama film "Blue Jasmine," marking the 44-year-old Australian actress' second win and fifth nomination.
 The winners were announced at a live ceremony that took place at the Dolby Theatre in Los Angeles and aired live on ABC on Sunday, March 2.  Blanchett beat Sandra Bullock of "Gravity," Judi Dench of "Philomena," Meryl Streep of "August: Osage County" and Amy Adams of "American Hustle"
"Blue Jasmine" is a dramatic comedy set in San Francisco, California and Blanchett portrays Jasmine, a posh woman whose lavish life in New York City falls apart after her husband is sent to prison for fraud.  She takes up with her less fortunate sister, Ginger (played by Oscar nominee Sally Hawkins), in San Francisco.  The film also stars Alec Baldwin, Bobby Cannavale, Louis C.K. and Andrew Dice Clay.
 The movie received three Oscar nominations, including one for Best Original Screenplay.
 Blanchett previously won an Oscar for Best Performance by an Actress in a Supporting Role for playing Hollywood legend Katharine Hepburn in the 2004 film "The Aviator." "
She was also nominated for Best Actress in a Leading Role for "Elizabeth: The Golden Age" and "Elizabeth." " The actress received supporting actress Oscar nods for her work in "Notes on a Scandal" and "I'm Not There." "
Blanchett has won several awards for performance in "Blue Jasmine" including a Golden Globe, a British Academy of Film and Television Arts award and a Screen Actors Guild award.
results.title: Oscars 2014: Cate Blanchett of 'Blue Jasmine' wins Leading Actress

results.body:
They are Australia's golden duo, Cate Blanchett and Catherine Martin, who collected Oscars at Hollywood's biggest night and in the process etched their names in the record books.
 Martin became the most prolific Australian winner at the Academy Awards, surpassing the trailblazing costume designer Orry George Kelly who claimed three Oscars in the 1950s and 60s for An American in Paris, Cole Porter's Les Girls and Some Like it Hot.
 Martin left Hollywood's Dolby Theatre on Sunday with two statuettes in her hands, costume design and production design, for The Great Gatsby.
 She won two in 2002 for costume design and art direction for another film directed by husband, Baz Luhrmann.
 'I am speechless,' said Martin, when asked about eclipsing her idol, who was known in Hollywood as Orry-Kelly.
 'I don't know how I feel about it, other than very happy.' '
Martin's The Great Gatsby set decorator, Beverley Dunn, shared the production design Oscar.
 Blanchett put an exclamation point at the tail end of the ceremony for Australia when, as expected, she won the best actress Oscar for her performance as an imploding, martini-chugging, pill-popping New York socialite in Woody Allen's Blue Jasmine.
 'There is so much talent in Australia,' Blanchett said.
 'CM and I are just the tip of the iceberg.' '
Blanchett's win was also an historic moment in Australian film.
 Blanchett became the first Australian actor to win more than one Oscar, setting herself apart from single winners Nicole Kidman, Geoffrey Rush, Russell Crowe, Peter Finch and Heath Ledger.
 Blanchett won a supporting actress trophy in 2005 for her portrayal of screen great Katharine Hepburn in the Howard Hughes biopic The Aviator.
 The 86th Academy Awards, hosted by Ellen Degeneres, was billed as a battle between 12 Years a Slave, Gravity and American Hustle.
 In the end Gravity collected the most Oscars, seven mostly for technical awards, while 12 Years A Slave took the grandest, best picture, as well as adapted screenplay and supporting actress for newcomer Lupita Nyong'o.
 Dallas Buyers Club duo, Matthew McConaughey and Jared Leto, won the best actor and supporting actor awards respectively.
 The big disappointment was American Hustle, with 10 nominations but not a single win.
results.title: Golden Oscar night for two great Cates

results.body:
Cate Blanchett has won the 2014 Oscar for lead actress, for her role in Woody Allen's "Blue Jasmine." " It is the six-time nominee's second Oscar, having previously won the supporting-actress award for 2004's "The Aviator." "
As much as those in the Dolby Theater pretended to be surprised upon hearing her name announced, Blanchett's Sunday-night win at the 86 annual Academy Awards was among the night's least suspenseful.  With a performance that had earned her award after award on the pre-Oscar circuit, she was the clear front-runner long before Oscar rolled out the red carpet.
 That was true even though Blanchett was going up against an all-name field of nominees.  Others nominated for the award this year were Amy Adams ("American Hustle"), Sandra Bullock ("Gravity"), Judi Dench ("Philomena") and Meryl Street ("August: Osage County").
 But Blanchett's heartbreaking portrait of a woman unraveling in Allen's San Francisco-set drama proved as hard for Academy voters to forget as it was for them to ignore.
 Aside from her "Aviator" win, Blanchett's previous Oscar nominations came in the lead-actress category for 1998's "Elizabeth" and 2007's "Elizabeth: The Golden Age," and in the supporting-actress category for 2006's "Notes on a Scandal" and 2007's "I'm Not Here." "
results.title: Oscars 2014: Cate Blanchett wins lead-actress Academy Award for 'Blue Jasmine'

results.body:
Cate Blanchett has won the Academy Award for best actress Blue Jasmine and Matthew McConaughey has won best actor for Dallas Buyer's Club.
 Blanchett had been deemed the front-runner from the very beginning of the Oscar season.  It was the sixth Oscar nomination for the Australian actress and her second win, though her first in the leading actress category.  Previously she won the 2005 supporting actress trophy for The Aviator.
results.title: Cate Blanchett and Matthew McConaughey win best actor and actress

results.body:
Cate Blanchett, barely visible in the darkness, said what everyone else in the room, from former Spider-Man Tobey Maguire to Kiwi songstress Lorde, was thinking.
 "It has to be an omen for CM," Blanchett whispered.
 CM is Catherine Martin, the former North Sydney Girls High School student who, around lunchtime on Monday AEDT, is expected to become the most prolific Australian winner of Oscars.
 Martin has been nominated for six Academy Awards since 1997, won two for Moulin Rouge! in 2002 and in 2014 is aiming for another double win in the costume design and production design categories for her work on husband Baz Luhrmann's film update of F Scott Fitzgerald's great American novel, The Great Gatsby.
 The spooky moment came at an event for Martin on Friday night inside Greystone Mansion, a 1928 Tudor-style estate in the Hollywood Hills that some say is haunted.
 A rain storm was battering the windows outside, strong winds made their way inside and slightly rocked the chandeliers above and just as Mimi Gramatky, president of the Art Directors Guild, told the crowd in a speech how Martin was a "two-time Oscar winner", the power went out in the mansion.
 Were the ghosts of Greystone telling the A-List crowd what bookmakers and Oscar analysts think is a near certainty?
 Martin will soon take two more Oscars to become a four-time winner.
 If true, Martin will jump ahead of Australia's first great Hollywood costume designer, Orry George Kelly, who was known simply in Tinseltown as Orry-Kelly and won three Oscars.
 "Oh my goodness gracious," Martin, 49, told AAP when asked what it would mean to eclipse the Oscar tally of her idol.
 "I couldn't even hope to attain those heights.
 "What an incredible man and what an incredible inspiration." "
Kiama-born Orry-Kelly, who worked on more than 100 Hollywood films including Casablanca, The Maltese Falcon and 42nd Street, won his Oscars in 1952 for the Gene Kelly musical An American in Paris, in 1958 for Cole Porter's Les Girls and in 1960 for dressing Marilyn Monroe, Tony Curtis and Jack Lemmon in the comedy Some Like it Hot.
 The 86th Academy Awards will likely be a golden one for Australia even if Martin goes home empty-handed, with Blanchett the runaway favourite to win best actress for Blue Jasmine.
 Blanchett, who won a supporting actress Oscar in 2005 for The Aviator, will jump ahead of Nicole Kidman, Geoffrey Rush, Russell Crowe, Peter Finch and Heath Ledger as the first Australian actor to win more than one Academy Award.
 If Martin, the favourite for the costume design, does not win, it will likely be fellow Sydneysider Michael Wilkinson for the 1970s costumes he put together for Jennifer Lawrence, Amy Adams and the other stars of best picture nominee, American Hustle.
 Joining Martin as a nominee in the production design category for The Great Gatsby is another Aussie, Beverley Dunn.
 Australian animator David Clayton, for his work on The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug, is up for a visual effects Oscar, but the team from Gravity is expected to take the prize.
 American Hustle and the space disaster film Gravity, starring Sandra Bullock and George Clooney, have the most Oscar nominations with 10 each, while 12 Years a Slave, favourite for best picture, has nine.
 The Academy Awards red carpet will begin 10am AEDT Monday with the ceremony from 12.30pm AEDT Monday.
results.title: Blanchett, Martin up for Oscars records

results.body:
Keep the vodka flowing because Cate Blanchett just won her second career Oscar.
 Blanchett, 44, receives the Academy Award in the best actress category for "Blue Jasmine," the Woody Allen film in which she stars as Jasmine, a high-society woman living in New York who falls from grace and has to move in with her sister in San Francisco.
 Winning the best actress award for the same role at January's Golden Globes, Blanchett was effusive in her graciousness, but maintained a sense of humor about the awards ceremony.
 "Thank you for plying me with vodka the way Judy Garland was probably plied with barbiturates," she said, accepting the Globe.
 The "Blue Jasmine" cast includes Union City native Bobby Cannavale, comedian Louis C.K., Alec Baldwin, Sally Hawkins -- who received a nomination for best supporting actress -- Peter Sarsgaard and Andrew Dice Clay.  Woody Allen was also nominated for best original screenplay.
 In 2005, Blanchett won an Oscar for best supporting actress, for playing Katharine Hepburn in "The Aviator." "
results.title: Oscars 2014: Cate Blanchett wins her second for 'Blue Jasmine'

results.body:
Cate Blanchett, tal y como se esperaba, se erigió en la ganadora del Oscar a la mejor actriz por su interpretación en "Blue Jasmine", dirigida por Woody Allen.
 Sus rivales eran Sandra Bullock ("Gravity"), Amy Adams ("La gran estafa americana"), Judi Dench ("Philomena") y Meryl Streep ("Agosto").
 Blanchett, que reconoció con gracia el talento de las demás candidatas, quiso dar las gracias especialmente a Allen por su "extraordinario guión".
 "Estoy orgullosa de que la película haya logrado estar tanto tiempo en los cines.  Gracias al estudio Sony Pictures Classics, a los espectadores y a aquellos en la industria que no piensan que cintas protagonizadas por mujeres son un nicho.  La gente quiere verlas y de hecho recaudan dinero", manifestó, provocando una gran ovación.
 Desde el estreno de "Blue Jasmine" en julio, Blanchett ha aparecido en todas las listas de favoritas para los Oscar gracias a este papel, tan arriesgado como agradecido, escrito para ella por Woody Allen.  Es su sexta nominación y ya había ganado el Globo de Oro, el SAG, el Critics Choice y el Bafta por esta interpretación.
 La película cuenta la historia de una adinerada mujer de las altas esferas de Nueva York que ve cómo su vida se derrumba tras descubrir las estafas inmobiliarias de su esposo.  Debido a ello, decide trasladarse a San Francisco (California), mientras se recupera de la depresión que sufre a base de antidepresivos.
 Es el segundo Oscar de la actriz australiana tras el obtenido por "El Aviator" en 2005 y cuenta con otras cuatro nominaciones.
results.title: Cate Blanchett se hace con el Óscar a la mejor actriz por "Blue Jasmine"

results.body:
LOS ANGELES -- Cate Blanchett ganó el Premio de la Academia a la mejor actriz por su intensa interpretación de una frágil dama de sociedad caída en desgracia en "Blue Jasmine", de Woody Allen.
 Al recibir el premio la actriz pidió a Hollywood que deje de pensar en las películas protagonizadas por mujeres como "experiencias de nicho".
 "¡El mundo es muy grande señores!", dijo en medio de una gran ovación.
 Blanchett se perfilaba como la favorita para el galardón desde el comienzo de la temporada de premios.  Era la sexta nominación al Oscar para la actriz australiana y su segunda victoria, aunque la primera fue en la categoría de actriz de reparto, en 2005 por "The Aviator".
 Las otras nominadas de la noche eran Amy Adams por "American Hustle", Sandra Bullock por "Gravity", Judi Dench por "Philomena" y Meryl Streep por "August: Osage County".
 La 86a entrega de los Oscar se transmitió desde el Teatro Dolby de Los Ángeles.
results.title: Cate Blanchett gana el Oscar a la mejor actriz

results.body:
Los Ángeles (EE.UU.), 2 mar (EFE).- - Cate Blanchett, tal y como se esperaba, se erigió en la ganadora del Óscar a la mejor actriz por su interpretación en "Blue Jasmine", dirigida por Woody Allen.
 Sus rivales eran Sandra Bullock ("Gravity"), Amy Adams ("American Hustle"), Judi Dench ("Philomena") y Meryl Streep ("August: Osage County").
 Blanchett, que reconoció con gracia el talento de las demás candidatas, quiso dar las gracias especialmente a Allen por su "extraordinario guión".
 "Estoy orgullosa de que la película haya logrado estar tanto tiempo en los cines.  Gracias al estudio Sony Pictures Classics, a los espectadores y a aquellos en la industria que no piensan que cintas protagonizadas por mujeres son un nicho.  La gente quiere verlas y de hecho recaudan dinero", manifestó, provocando una gran ovación.
 Desde el estreno de "Blue Jasmine" en julio, Blanchett ha aparecido en todas las listas de favoritas para los Óscar gracias a este papel, tan arriesgado como agradecido, escrito para ella por Woody Allen.  Es su sexta nominación y ha ganado el Globo de Oro, el SAG, el Critics Choice y el Bafta por esta interpretación.
 La película cuenta la historia de una adinerada mujer de las altas esferas de Nueva York que ve cómo su vida se derrumba tras descubrir las estafas inmobiliarias de su esposo.  Debido a ello, decide trasladarse a San Francisco (California), mientras se recupera de la depresión que sufre a base de antidepresivos.
 Es su segundo Óscar tras el obtenido por "The Aviator" (2005).
results.title: Cate Blanchett se hace con el Óscar a la mejor actriz por "Blue ... - EFE

results.body:
Se han cumplido los pronósticos y Cate Blanchett se ha llevado su merecidísimo Oscar 2014 a la mejor actriz por su extraordinario papel de mujer de la alta sociedad neoyorquina venida a menos en Blue Jasmine, de Woody Allen.  La actriz australiana ya había arrasado anteriormente con todos los premios a los que había sido nominada en la categoría de mejor actriz.
 Blanchett ha agradecido su premio a todas las otras actrices nominadas y especialmente a Woody Allen, además de a su familia y a todo el reparto de la película.  La actriz también ha agradecido especialmente a la compañía de teatro de Sydney donde empezó su exitosa carrera.  "Las películas con mujeres son atractivas para el público" ha asegurado.
 Se trata de la segunda estatuilla que la australiana se lleva a casa, tras la obtenida en 2004 por encarnar nada más y nada menos que a Katharine Hepburn en El aviador, de Martin Scorsese.  La intérprete competía en esta categoría con la estafadora Amy Adams de La gran estafa americana, la astronauta Sandra Bullock de Gravity, Meryl Streep, por Agosto y la británica Judi Dench por Philomena.
results.title: Cate Blanchett, mejor actriz en los Oscar 2014 - La Vanguardia

results.body:
LOS ANGELES (Reuters) - La australiana Cate Blanchett ganó el domingo el Oscar a mejor actriz por su papel de una mujer de alta sociedad que sufre una crisis en la película de Woody Allen "Blue Jasmine".
 El triunfo es el segundo premio de la Academia para Blanchett.  La actriz, de 44 años, era la favorita para ganar la estatuilla este año tras haberse hecho con galardones en la misma categoría en los Globos de Oro, el Sindicato de Actores y los BAFTA.
results.title: Cate Blanchett, mejor actriz en los Oscar por "Blue Jasmine"

results.body:
Matthew McConaughey y Cate Blanchett consiguieron el Óscar a Mejor actor y actriz principal en la edición 86 de los Óscar.
 McConaughey se impuso por su papel en el filme 'Dallas Buyers Club', superando a Leonardo DiCaprio ("The Wolf of Wall Street") y al veterano Bruce Dern ("Nebraska"), favoritos también para llevarse el galardón.
 Mientras, Cate Blanchett ganó el Óscar a mejor actriz por la cinta de Woody Allen 'Blue Jasmine'.
 En su discurso de agradecimiento, Blanchett rindió tributo a sus competidoras Sandra Bullock ("Gravedad"), Judi Dench ("Philomena"), Amy Adams ("Escándalo americano") y Meryl Streep ("Agosto").
 "Aunque este premio sea tan azaroso y subjetivo, significa muchísimo en un año de extraordinarias actuaciones hechas por mujeres", dijo la australiana de 44 años.
results.title: Matthew McConaughey y Cate Blanchett se llevan el Óscar

results.body:
La australiana es favorita para ganar el Oscar 2014 a Mejor Actriz
LOS ÁNGELES (Notimex).- - Cate Blanchett, favorita para ganar el Oscar 2014 en la categoría de Mejor Actriz, aseguró que las películas protagonizadas por mujeres 'sí hacen dinero'.
 'Me siento muy orgullosa al confirmar que la gente fue a verla y que la película hizo dinero, pues hay un mito en Hollywood que asegura que los filmes protagonizados por mujeres no hacen dinero, pero sí lo hacen, por eso hay que felicitar a Sandra Bullock, a Meryl Streep y la lista sigue', expresó.
 Luciendo un atuendo de Giorgio Armani, durante la alfombra roja de esta entrega de premios, destacó que para lograr la perfección de 'Blue Jasmine", largometraje que protagoniza bajo la pluma y la dirección de Woody Allen, 'la relación creativa fue fundamental, así se logró la identidad de mi personaje'.
results.title: Cate Blanchett dice que filmes con mujeres "sí hacen dinero" - El Diario de Yucatán

results.body:
Sídney -- Woody Allen logró llevar a la estrella australiana Cate Blanchett de regreso al cine, pero su aplaudida interpretación de una mujer de la alta sociedad neoyorquina caída en desgracia en la película "Blue Jasmine" no impresionó inicialmente al legendario director.
 Sin embargo, Blanchett, de 44 años, obtuvo su segundo Óscar el domingo, esta vez en la categoría de mejor actriz, por este papel, que esta temporada de premios ya le había valido un Globo de Oro y un trofeo SAG del Sindicato de Actores de Estados Unidos, así como un Bafta británico.
 "Estuve alejada de la industria cinematográfica durante largo tiempo, haciendo teatro", declaró recientemente la actriz, que en 2005 ganó el Óscar a mejor actriz de reparto por "El aviador".
 Pero el inexorable derrumbe de Jasmine pareció conjugar sus pasiones por el escenario y la pantalla.
 "Hay algo inherentemente teatral y con una pizca de 'standup' en la forma de trabajar de Allen, así que quizás yo estaba preparada para eso", añadió.
 Blanchett describió a su personaje como un "cóctel explosivo" de desilusión, culpabilidad y "monumental vergüenza social", para el cual se inspiró en Ruth Madoff, la esposa del financista Bernard Madoff, condenado en 2009 a 150 años de cárcel por la que se considera la mayor estafa bursátil de la hioria.
 Blanchett también ha comparado al personaje de Jasmine con Blanche Dubois, la "superviviente" con delirios de grandeza del clásico "Un tranvía llamado Deseo", a la que encarnó en las tablas en una aclamada interpretación en 2009.
 - Un inicio difícil -
Su último éxito parecía al principio esquivo.
 "El primer día, (Allen) dijo 'Es horrible.  Tú eres horrible'", contó la actriz en una reciente entrevista.
 La segunda toma "siguió siendo horrible", agregó.  "(Pero) no cabe duda de que mejoró, porque... usted sabe, la gente ha ido a ver la película".
 Blanchett, nacida y educada en Melbourne, es hija de un ejecutivo publicitario de Texas que murió de un infarto cuando ella tenía 10 años.
 Su madre tuvo que luchar para pagar las cuentas y ambas sintieron el "pánico de la lucha financiera", que condujo a la joven, a los 14 años, a mentir sobre su edad para obtener un empleo en un asilo de ancianos.
 Se graduó en el Instituto Nacional de Artes Dramáticas de Australia en 1992, después de abandonar sus estudios de historia del arte, y en algo más de un año obtuvo el favor de la crítica y del público con una serie de papeles con la Compañía Teatral de Sídney.
 Fue la primera persona galardonada con el Premio del Círculo de la Crítica Teatral por mejor debutante y actriz principal el mismo año, por su papel en "Oleanna", de David Mamet, frente a la estrella de "Shine", Geoffrey Rush.
 "Blue Jasmine" fue la sexta candidatura al Óscar de Blanchett y su segundo premio, tras alzarse con la estatuilla por interpretar a Katharine Hepburn en el film de Martin Scorsese "El aviador".
 Tomó vacaciones prolongadas de la industria cinematográfica después de ser nombrada directora artística de la Compañía Teatral de Sídney, cargo que compartía con el dramaturgo Andrew Upton, con el cual está casada desde hace 17 años y con quien tiene tres hijos.
 Recientemente, la pareja anunció que Upton continuará solo en ese cargo a partir de 2014, para que Blanchett pueda dedicarse íntegramente a su carrera de actriz.
results.title: Un Óscar marca el regreso triunfal de Cate Blanchett al cine - AFP

results.body:
La keniata-mexicana Lupita Nyong"o, ganadora del Óscar a mejor actriz de reparto por su papel en el drama histórico "12 años de esclavitud", impactó con un vestido sin mangas azul pálido plisado de Prada con un pronunciado escote en V y una diadema como tocado.
 La actriz australiana Cate Blanchett, que se quedó con la estatuilla a la mejor actriz por su papel en la película de Woody Allen "Blue Jasmine", lució un vaporoso vestido de Armani, transparente y cubierto de pedrería.  "Es pesado, pero me encanta", aseguró la artista, generalmente aplaudida por sus elecciones de moda.
 - Tonos pálidos, el denominador común -
Los vestidos en tonos pálidos fueron el denominador común en la alfombra roja: a la tendencia se sumaron la coestrella de Blanchett Sally Hawkins, la nominada a mejor actriz y gran dama de Hollywood Meryl Streep, la estrella de "Frozen" Kristen Bell, la australiana Naomi Watts y la actriz francesa Julie Delpy.
results.title: En la gala de los Óscar la moda también dijo presente

results.body:
LOS ÃNGELES, California(El Universal) Cate Blanchett, quien ganÃ³ ayer el premio Ã"scar a la Mejor Actriz confesÃ³ que uno de sus secretos de belleza es usar constantemente mascarillas para el rostro, incluso cuando viaja en aviÃ³n.
 Blanchett, originaria de Australia y de 44 aÃ±os recibiÃ³ la famosa estatuilla por su papel protagÃ³nico en la cinta de Woody Allen, Blue Jasmine, donde su belleza natural sale a relucir constantemente.
 De acuerdo a una entrevista de Glamour, la bella actriz debe su cuidado rostro al uso de mascarillas de la firma asiÃ¡tica SX II las cuales parecen vendajes.
 "Las uso todo el tiempo.  Tanto que incluso olvido que las llevo puestas.  Comunmente espero a que las luces, del aviÃ³n, hayan sido apagadas (para ponÃ©rselas)", declarÃ³ Blanchett.
 Gracioso olvido
La ganadora del Ã"scar afirma que se ha vuelto tan seguidora de estas mÃ¡scaras, que a veces olvida que las lleva puestas y sale a la calle con ellas.
 "Una ocasiÃ³n un vecino me preguntÃ³ si habÃ­a tenido un accidente debido a que no me quitÃ© una parte del ojo, entonces parecÃ­a que estaba herida", confesÃ³ la guapa rubia.
 El Jet Lag
Por su profesiÃ³n, Blanchett es una viajera constante asÃ­ que Â¿CÃ³mo supera el jet lag?  Elle Magazine publicÃ³ que la guapa australiana suele tomar Vitamina C, ademÃ¡s de usar una fÃ³rmula de protecciÃ³n solar para la piel.
 TambiÃ©n suele estar lo mÃ¡s fuera posible cuando llega a su destino para aclimatarse, de acuerdo a sus propias declaraciones.
results.title: Las máscaras de belleza de Cate Blanchett

results.title: Un Óscar marca el regreso triunfal de Cate Blanchett al cine

results.body:
Blanchett apareció en todas las listas de favoritas desde el estreno de "Blue Jasmine", en donde hace el papel de una mujer adinerada de Nueva York que ve cómo su vida se derrumba tras descubrir las estafas de su esposo.
 Se trata de la sexta nominación de la actriz, que se llevó por esta interpretación el Globo de Oro, el SAG, el Critics Choice y el Bafta.
 Este es segundo Óscar tras el obtenido por "The Aviator".
 Sus principales rivales, Sandra Bullock (Gravity) y Amy Adams (American Hustle) finalmente se quedaron sin el Oscar, al igual que las veteranas Meryl Streep y Judi Dench.
results.title: Cate Blanchett, de favorita a ganadora del Oscar
